meanings.definition: The act of disposing of something again.
meanings.sent1: After the garage sale, she had to make several redispositions of the remaining items.
meanings.sent2: The redispositions of the furniture in the room made it look more spacious.
meanings.sent3: His constant redispositions of his desk made his coworkers chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The redispositions of power within the company caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent5: The redispositions of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to solve.

meanings.definition: A tendency to behave in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: Her redispositions towards kindness made her a beloved member of the community.
meanings.sent2: His redispositions towards procrastination often led to unfinished tasks.
meanings.sent3: The dog's redispositions towards chasing squirrels always amused the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The redispositions of the river to flood every spring were predictable.
meanings.sent5: The child's redispositions towards curiosity made learning exciting for him.
